intro: Elliottia bracteata, commonly known as the bracted ellottia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a glossy surface. Elliottia bracteata typically grows in moist, wooded areas and is often found in shaded environments.
